abstract: Aviad Meitar, chairman of Quadrant European Beverages, reminisces about the early days of pitching Pepsi in a joyless corner of the former Soviet bloc.
snippet: Aviad Meitar, chairman of Quadrant European Beverages, reminisces about the early days of pitching Pepsi in a joyless corner of the former Soviet bloc.
lead_paragraph: I’VE been a frequent business traveler for more than 20 years. I now live in Tel Aviv, but when I was a young executive, I was based in New York. My trips back then were short, mostly to the Midwest and sometimes to the West Coast.

headline.main: Taking the Pepsi Franchise to an Ice-Cold Romania
headline.print_headline: Taking the Pepsi Franchise To an Ice-Cold Romania
